title: What is the GPA required to able to join Air Force Academy? How should you prepare yourself to enroll in the Air Force Academy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Jayden — for starters I’ve got 17 years experience as an official Air Force Academy liaison officer (ALO) — working with 11th and 12th graders who want to go to USAFA. In general it’s going to take about a 3.5 GPA to make the cut on the academic side of things. Academics are a big piece of the application process, but not everything. Assuming you are in high school, ask your guidance counselor for the contact info for your school’s ALO. Get in touch with this person and ask for their assistance. In addition to academics (and qualifying medically to be an Air Force Officer) I suggest you focus on ‘leadership’ situations in high school. All the Service academies value things like Scouts, sports, club activities, elected office in school, volunteer work, etc. Pick a few things that interest you and focus on them. Your ALO will tell you that you also need a Nomination (Nom) from a U.S. Senator or a Congressperson. So, get in touch with your school’s ALO as soon as possible. Be early, not late! Best wishes.

Prepscholar says the average accepted GPA is a 3.84 and the average new sat score is a 1370. If you want to get in, you should be around there academically. However, you will also need good extracurriculars that show them you would be good at the academy.
